    • Method Detail

      • writeDotForDependencies

        public void writeDotForDependencies(boolean shouldLabelEdges)
        The core method of the parser. Through it, it parses the project's data in order to generate a .dot file that is a visual digraph representation of the kafka dependencies between microservices.

        In such graph representation, every microservice that produces to/consumes from a kafka topic is represented by an edge. Naturally, the topic defines the relation between two or more microservices by being a vertex.

        In this directed graph, a vertex "comes from" a kafka producer and "is pointed at" a kafka consumer.

        Parameters:
        shouldLabelEdges - a boolean indicating whether or not the edges in the digraph should be labeled with the topics that are responsible for the relation itself. If true, the output graph will be directed to the "graph_with_labels.dot" and otherwise, it'll be directed to "graph_no_labels.dot"

      • printGraphRelation

        public void printGraphRelation(java.util.List<GraphRelation> graphRelations)
        Auxiliary method used for debug purposes. It prints out on the console a String representation for graphRelations
        Parameters:
        graphRelations - a List of the graphRelation data structured to be printed

      • writeFullRelation

        private void writeFullRelation(java.io.BufferedWriter output,
                               java.util.List<java.lang.String> producers,
                               java.util.List<java.lang.String> consumers,
                               java.lang.String topic,
                               boolean shouldLabelEdges)
                        throws java.io.IOException
        Auxiliary method that writes a full relation (e.g. producer - consumer) onto the .dot file that represents the graph.
        Parameters:
        output - the BufferedWriter responsible for writing the relation
        producers - a List containing the producers for a given relation
        consumers - a List containing the consumers for a given relation
        topic - a String containing the topic of the relation
        shouldLabelEdges - a boolean indicating if the edges should be labeled with the relation's topic
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - due to the buffered writer write() call

      • writeSoloKafkaElement

        private void writeSoloKafkaElement(java.io.BufferedWriter output,
                                   java.util.List<java.lang.String> kafkaElements)
                            throws java.io.IOException
        Auxiliary method that writes a relation with no edges (e.g. a kafka producer producing to a topic no other kafka class consumes).
        Parameters:
        output - the BufferedWriter responsible for writing the relation
        kafkaElements - a List of either kafka producers or consumers that produce/write to a given topic
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - due to the buffered writer write() call

      • generateGraphRelations

        private java.util.List<GraphRelation> generateGraphRelations()
        Generates a GraphRelation.class list, consisting of the dependency relations between microservices. This GraphRelation.class is a auxiliary data structure used in order to generate the .dot file.
        Returns:
        a List of GraphRelation.class
        See Also:
        GraphRelation

      • initGraphRelation

        private java.util.List<GraphRelation> initGraphRelation()
                                                 throws java.lang.IllegalAccessException
        Initializes an empty (edge-wise) GraphRelation.class list with the topics provided by the KafkaTopicNaming.class.
        Returns:
        an initialized (with only the topics) GraphRelation.class list
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalAccessException - Even though in architectures 2.0 and 3.0 this exception isn't thrown, there is no guarantee that in previous or further architectures this will happen.
        See Also:
        GraphRelation, KafkaTopicNaming

      • handleException

        private void handleException(java.lang.Exception ex)
        Helper method that handles a generic exception.
        Parameters:
        ex - exception handled

      • generateMicroserviceRelation

        private void generateMicroserviceRelation(java.lang.String microservice,
                                          java.util.List<GraphRelation> graphRelations)
                                   throws java.lang.ClassNotFoundException
        Method that for a given microservice, creates its corresponding graph relation within graphRelations.
        Parameters:
        microservice - microservice whose relations will be built
        graphRelations - a List of the GraphRelation data structure
        Throws:
        java.lang.ClassNotFoundException - rethrows from the getClassesInKafkaDirectories method

      • checkKafkaRoleAndCreateVertex

        private void checkKafkaRoleAndCreateVertex(java.util.Set<java.lang.String> kafkaClasses,
                                           java.util.List<GraphRelation> graphRelations,
                                           java.lang.String microservice)
                                    throws java.lang.ClassNotFoundException
        For each class name within the kafkaClasses parameter, this method determines if such classes is either a kafka consumer or a kafka producer and then create its owning microservice vertex on graphRelations.
        Parameters:
        kafkaClasses - A set of String containing all kafka classes names
        graphRelations - a List of the GraphRelation data structure
        microservice - owning microservice for the set of kafka classes
        Throws:
        java.lang.ClassNotFoundException - if the given class String within kafkaClasses cannot be found
        See Also:
        GraphRelation

      • createConsumerVertex

        private void createConsumerVertex(java.util.List<GraphRelation> graphRelations,
                                  java.lang.String consumerName,
                                  java.lang.String microservice)
        Creates a consumer vertex within graphRelations for a given microservice if the consumerName parameter matches an existing topic.
        Parameters:
        graphRelations - a List of the graphRelation data structure
        consumerName - the class name for a kafka consumer
        microservice - owning microservice for the consumer
        See Also:
        GraphRelation

                                  java.lang.String producerName,
                                  java.lang.String microservice)
        Creates a producer vertex within graphRelations for a given microservice if the producerName parameter matches an existing topic.
        Parameters:
        graphRelations - a List of the graphRelation data structure
        producerName - the class name for a kafka producer
        microservice - owning microservice for the producer
        See Also:
        GraphRelation

      • nameMatchingTopic

        public static boolean nameMatchingTopic(java.lang.String topic,
                                        java.lang.String kafkaClass,
                                        java.lang.String suffix)
        Defines if a certain kafka class (e.g. a consumer) has a lexicographical relation with a given topic.
        Parameters:
        topic - the topic to be compared
        kafkaClass - the kafka element class that'll be compared
        suffix - String indicating if the kafka element being compared is a consumer or a producer
        Returns:
        a boolean indicating if there's a correlation

      • generateClassString

        protected java.lang.String generateClassString(java.lang.String filePath)
        Creates a proper kafka class name from a given file path.
        Parameters:
        filePath - String representing the file path that will be converted on a class name
        Returns:
        a String representing a class that can be used as an argument for getClass (reflection)

      • locateMicroserviceDirectory

        private java.lang.String locateMicroserviceDirectory(java.lang.String target)
        Method that returns the String representation of the absolute directory path that contains the target microservice or an empty String if such directory doesn't exist.
        Parameters:
        target - the microservice whose directory is searched
        Returns:
        a String containing the absolute path for a given target microservice of an empty String if the directory isn't found

      • getClassesInKafkaDirectories

        protected abstract java.util.Set<java.lang.String> getClassesInKafkaDirectories(java.util.Set<java.lang.String> kafkaDirectories)
        Method that converts all files within a kafka directory to their proper class names. Since the structure of a kafka directory may differ between architectural versions (e.g. the kafka directories have sub directories, for instance), is up for the concrete implementations of this classes to implement this method.
        Parameters:
        kafkaDirectories - a set containing all kafka directories for a given microservice
        Returns:
        a set containing all kafka-related class names within the given kafka directories

      • locateKafkaDirectories

        private void locateKafkaDirectories(java.lang.String microserviceSourceDirectory,
                                    java.util.Set<java.lang.String> kafkaDirectories)
        Method that locates all Kafka directories from a given microservice directory.
        Parameters:
        microserviceSourceDirectory - String representing the microservice source directory that should be searched for kafka sub directories.
        kafkaDirectories - a set containing all the kafka directories found throughout the recursion

      • compare

        private static boolean compare(java.lang.String filePath,
                               java.lang.String target)
        Auxiliary method used in order to determine if a given file path has a lexicographical relation with a given target.
        Parameters:
        filePath - a String that represents the absolute path of the file that will be compared
        target - a String that represents some target value (e.g. a microservice name)
        Returns:
        a boolean value indicating if there's a relation or not between the parameters

      • isProducer

        private boolean isProducer(java.lang.Class<?> subjectClass)
        Method that uses reflection to determine whether or not a certain Class is a Kafka Producer.
        Parameters:
        subjectClass - the class that will be inspected
        Returns:
        a boolean value indicating if the given class is a Kafka Producer

      • isConsumer

        private boolean isConsumer(java.lang.Class<?> subjectClass)
        Method to determine whether or not a certain Class is a Kafka Consumer. It utilizes the same logic as the isProducer method.
        Parameters:
        subjectClass - the class that will be inspected
        Returns:
        a boolean value indicating if the given class is a Kafka Consumer
